instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP1V2_AWAKE: What is PP1V2_AWAKE? The PP1V2_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides 1.2 volts and is associated with the machine's awake state and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP0V9_SSD: What is PP0V9_SSD? PP0V9_SSD is a power rail that powers the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on Macbooks with soldered on storage and must be present for the SSD to show up. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message:
Board had a short on the CB308, the UB300 a little burned. I replaced both, but the problem remains.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.3v
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> - 3.3v

I have no voltages on the AWAKE and SLPS2R lines of the <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.

It is recognized in DFU mode, I tried to revive and restore, both give errors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message:
LDO lines in diode mode. All the same.

1.8 - 0.470
3v3 - 0.496
1.1 - 0.510
1.8 - 0.511

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message:
All ports have the same behavior?
Do you get 1V1 LDO on every <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message:
Yes, all ports behave the same.

I have 1.1v on all <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>'s. This line only has voltage on the connected port, correct?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message: None of the coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> has voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message:
Strange, I went to measure, now I have tension.

<SIGNAL>PP1V1_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> : 1.1 Volt
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> : 1.8 Volt
<SIGNAL>PP0V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> : 0.7 Volt
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_AWAKE</SIGNAL> : 1.1 Volt
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_AWAKE</SIGNAL> : 3.3 Volt

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message:
Yeah, it shouldn't enter to DFU without these voltages.
I just wanted to confirm actual state.

What error do you get in DFU?
Any SSD, or G3S voltage tries to appear?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message:
In DFU it stays a long time on "Installing system" and then the error:
Gave up waiting for device to transition from
DFU state to DFU state.
[com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore -
OxFCA (4042)]

I have no voltage on SSD, <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD</SIGNAL>!

nothing on the G3S 3.3v and 1.8v line.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message:
Be sure no short on any SSD, or G3S power rail.
I had a case when these voltages come on after several failed DFU attempts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message:
There are no shorts.

I will try to restore in DFU again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message:
I bought the S-UEM2 device and decided to go back to work on that abandoned mac.

It showed changes in some pins of the UB300 (31, 33, 40, 42), as it had already been changed, I tried to change it again.

[ATTACH type="full"]61176[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message: I connected the cable the wrong way. It didn't report any failures.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5v / 0,25a
threads.message:
Reflash SoC ROM and try DFU again.
Don't forget to make backup first.
